XXVI. And be it enacted, That where any freehold shall have beat duly registered as being of the value of fifty pounds or of twenty pounds respectively, the registry whereof shall at the commencement of tbit Act be a valid and unexpired registry according to the provisions of any Act now in force, it shall not be necessary during the subsistence of such registry to register such freehold under the provisions of this Act.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That no registry hereafter to be made sf any freehold shall be valid, unless made conformably to the provisions of this Act

XXVIII. And be it further enacted, That no person shall be admitted to vote at any election of a member or members to serve in Parliament by virtue of any freehold of less annual value than fifty pounds, registered under the provisions of this Act, unless he shall have registered the sene within eight years preceding the test of the writ for holding such eiecbsa.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That in case of any registry of a freehold within this Act, the clerk of the peace for each county in Ireland shsU keep the like books, make the like returns, and discharge and execute all other the like duties, mattery and things as he is now by law authorised, entitled, or required to do with respect to the registry of freeholds in sarii county, save so far as is otherwise ordained by this Act; and that all matters and things now by law authorized or required for the due registration of such freeholds shall be in all respects done, performed, observed, and fulfilled, and all provisions, penalties, rules, orders, regulations, and conditions relating to the registration of such freeholds, sad contained in any Act or Acts now in force, shall be used, applied, i enforced with respect to and shall be construed to extend to all Mm to be registered under this Act, as if the same had been herein < save so far as is hereby otherwise provided.

XXX. And be it enacted, That all laws now in foroe touching the registering of freeholders in counties at large of the annual value of fifty pounds, twenty pounds, and forty shillings respectively, and touching the polling of persons qualified to vole at elections for such counties by virtue of such freeholds, shall be and the same are hereby extended to freeholders of the annual value under this Act of fifty pounds, twenty pounds, and ten pounds respectively, and that it shall be lawful Id substitute the words ten pounds for forty shillings in all matters relating to such freeholds, as circumstances may require.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That in the county of Dublin all freeholds to be registered under this Act shall be registered before the chairman of the sessions for that county, in the same manner in all respects as before the assistant barrister in any other county; and such chairman shall havr, exercise, perform, and discharge every power, jurisdiction, right, authority, duty, and function hereby vested in or given to any such assistatf barrister; and in any case where an appeal is hereby allowed from the order of an assistant barrister to the judges of assize, the like power of appeal from any order of such chairman shall and may, in the case of any freehold in the county of Dublin, be exercised and enjoyed to any of hi Majesty's superior law courts of record in Dublin; and the court to which any such appeal shall be made shall proceed with respect thereto in the same manner as any judge of assize is hereby authorized or required to proceed.

XXXII. And be it enacted, That every enactment herein contained relative to any assistant barrister or judge of assize shall, in the county of Dublin respectively, extend and apply to the chairman of the sessions of that county, and to lus Majesty’s superior law courts of record.

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That each riding in the county of Cork all be deemed to be a county for the purposes of this Act.

XXXIV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in this Act ntained shall extend or be construed to extend to alter or in any man-t affect the qualification now by law required to entitle any person to te at any election by virtue of any rent-charge.

XXXV. Provided also, and be it enacted, That no rector, vicar, or rate shall be obliged to register his freehold arising from his rectory, oarage, curacy, or other ecclesiastical preferment, or be precluded from ►ting at any election on account of his not having registered the same.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for every assistant mister to administer all such oaths as are by this Act required to be ken or administered.

XXXVII. And be it enacted, That the expences of printing the notices id of the advertisements hereby directed shall be defrayed by the clerk ' the peace in each county respectively; and the grand jury of each such >unty, or the term grand jury for the county of Dublin, as the case may 5, are hereby respectively required, at the next assizes or presenting !rm after such notices and advertisements, to present, to be levied off leir respective counties in the same manner as other sums are authorized

> be presented by such grand juries, all such sums as shall have been ne-sssanly disbursed by such clerks of the peace respectively, which sums tall be paid to such clerks of the peace.

XXXvIII. And be it enacted, That when the session herein directed

> be first holden for the purpose of registering freeholds shall have ter-linated in any county, the lord lieutenant or other chief governor or go-ernors of Ireland shall cause notice thereof to be inserted in the Dublin iazette; and that in case of a vacancy in the representation of any such aunty in this present Parliament before the publication of such notice of ie termination of the session for such county, no writ shall issue for the olding of an election of a knight of the shire for such county until after be publication of such notice.

XXXIX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That if after the com-lencement of this Act, and before the publication of such notice of the armination of the said first session in any county in Ireland, any election hall take place in pursuance of any writ issued for the election of mem-ers to serve in any new Parliament for such county, every person who rpuld have been entitled to vote at any such election in case this Act tad not been made shall be entitled to vote at the election to be holden a pursuance of any such writ; any thing in this Act contained notwithstanding.

XL. And be it enacted, That in case any exigency shall render it ne-essaiy for any assistant barrister to adjourn any session for the registry f freeholders so appointed to be first holden, it shall be lawful for him to 4joum and continue the same as circumstances may require.

XLI. And be k enacted, That it shall be lawful for the lord lieutenant r other chief governor of Ireland, by order or warrant under his hand, to iirect the payment, out of the consolidated fund, of such sum as he or bey shall deem sufficient to remunerate each assistant barrister and clerk f the peace for his attendance at the session to be first holden in pursu* nee of this Act.

XLII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall commence from and after he day next after the passing of this Act.

XLIII. And be it further enacted, That this Act may be amended, Itered, or repealed by any Act or Acts to be passed in this present session of Parliament.

SCHEDULE IV.

OATH of FREEHOLDER registering a Freehold of the Value of Fifty Founds [or Twenty Pounds, as the case may be] not arising Jrom a . Rent-charge.

I A.B. of in the county of

do swear, That I am a freeholder of the county of and that I have a freehold therein, arising from a house, [or houses, lands, or both, or other hereditaments, as the case may be, ] of the clear yearly value of fifty pounds [or twenty pounds, as the case may be, ] above all charges payable out of the same, lying and being at [naming the townland

or townlands, and barony or baronies, half barony or half baronies, wherein the freehold is situate in the said county, ] and that a solvent and responsible tenant could afford to pay for the same, as an additional rent, fairly and without collusion, the annual sum of fifty pounds, [or twenty pounds, as the ease may be, ] as I verily believe, over and above any rent which 1 am liable to pay for the same, and over and above all other charges, except only public or parliamentary taxes, county, church, or parish cesses, or rates and cesses on any townl&nd or division of any parish or barony; and that the said freehold does not arise from a rent-charge; and that I have not accepted or procured the said freehold fraudulently, nor in exchange for any freehold in any other county; and that I do not hold the said freehold by virtue of any lease, deed, or instrument executed dr made after the first day of July one thousand eight hundred and twenty-three, to any person or persons, jointly in common, or in partnership.

So help me GOD.
